result.execSummary:
The defendant Geoffrey P Salaja was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Attorney Fees to be paid directly to the Waushara Co Clerk of Court for Court Appointed Counsel in the amount of $681.60.  The previously paid deposit of $50.00 has been applied.  Attorney Fees to be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk.  Failure to comply will result in contempt procedures being initiated.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: ***Based upon written request by Defense counsel on May 6, 2016, the Defendant's report date has been amended to June 1, 2016.***  No Good Time Credit.  Huber Privileges granted.  Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Marquette County sentence the defendant is currently serving.

records.addlTxt: 2:52 pm case called. Defendant Geoffrey P Salaja in court with attorney Melinda R Alfredson-Clausen.  Defendant Geoffrey P Salaja in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation Order and Warrant received by both counsel. No errors or corrections by either counsel. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Alfredson-Clausen. Statement by Attorney  (represented defendant in the Marquette County matter he is currently serving a sentence on). Statement by defendant. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1- 8 years WSP concurrent to Marquette County Sentence to be served as 5 year IC and 3 yr ES. Credit for 340 days served. AODA and follow though,  Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Costs re-imposed not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. COUNT 3- 1 year WCJ with Good Time credit and Credit for 340 days. Concurrent to any existing sentence. Cost not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

Case Called @ 2:01 PM:  Defendant Geoffrey P Salaja in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA with argued terms on SEH.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 w/Enh: NC   Plea Ct 3:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Upon motion of the State, Ct 2 DRI.   Argument by ADA:  Argues for cond'l SEH as to Ct 1.  Argument by Atty Peebles:  Argues as to cond'l jail request, possible I/S jail SEH.  Statement by Def: Yes.  CNA Mary Posorske makes statement to the Court prior to SEH.  The Court:  Ct 1 & Ct 3 - S/W - 3 yrs - concurrent terms.  Conditions:  Ct 1 only - 8 mos WCJ cond'l - No GT, Huber, No TS.  Report:  5/9/16 @ 8:00 PM.  No objection to serving in another jurisdiction if can be arranged.  The Court has no authority to order concurrent/consecutive terms to any future sentence.  Both Counts:  AODA and any follow thru; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court Costs plus $40 Buy Money. No DNA Sample ordered as previously provided - Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Appeal Rights Given.  Ct Appt Atty Fees ordered repaid as an add'l cost with any bond money being applied first to atty fees and then court costs.

10:38 am case called. Defendant Geoffrey P Salaja in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Peebles confirms receipt and waives formal reading-entry of Not Guilty to all counts.    STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from DE regarding atty fee deposit - addressed at the 1/19/2016 AIA
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-02-2016 10:15 am

Case Called @ 1:55 PM: Defendant Geoffrey P Salaja in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Def as to status of counsel.  Defendant was previously advised of procedure for Court Appointment in light of him being found no eligible for SPD services.  Defendant states he wrote the Court last week regarding his inability to come up with the required deposit.  Court will require deposit paid - taxpayers will not be responsible for his fees.  Court advises Def that this must be a financial priority if he wants counsel.  Eligibility was declined due to residence and equity. Court will not make the public pay his attorney's fees - it would not be appropriate.  Defendant states he cannot come up with the funds required.    He is also paying $25 per month in Green Lake for attorney's fees.  The Court:  Will appoint Atty Peebles in this case immediately, already represented by him in Green Lake.  Commencing 2/15/16, payments to COC of no less than $50 per mo.  A condition of his bond to maintain the $50 payment.   AIA again rescheduled.  ADA states for the record that he will personally handle this case due to potential prior representation of the DA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-19-2016 01:45 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case called @ 1:30 p.m. Defendant Geoffrey P Salaja in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. The defendant must pay $250 by no later than 1/8/2016 then $50 monthly starting 2/1/2016 for court appointed counsel. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. No statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond. AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State .  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
